verses.text: 所以，你們既然與基督一同復活，就應當尋求天上的事，那裡有基督坐在 神的右邊。

words.note: Lit. 'return to life'
The leading space indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 你們要思念的，是天上的事，不是地上的事。

words.note: Implies focusing one's thoughts and intentions.

verses.text: 因為你們已經死了，你們的生命與基督一同隱藏在 神裡面。

words.note: The leading space indicates reverence for God.

verses.text: 基督就是你們的生命，他顯現的時候，你們也要和他一同在榮耀裡顯現。
所以要治死你們在地上的肢體，就如淫亂、污穢、邪情、惡慾和貪心，貪心就是拜偶像。

words.note: A biblical term referring to suppressing sinful desires.
Often used metaphorically for body parts, especially in scripture.
Refers to illicit sexual behavior.
Refers to unholy or wrong passions.
Refers to harmful or corrupt desires.
Lit. 'greedy heart'.
Lit. 'image figure'.

verses.text: 因著這些事， 神的忿怒必要臨到悖逆的人（有些抄本無「悖逆的人」）。

words.note: The raised character indicates reverence for God.
Stronger than general anger.
Used as an auxiliary verb here.

verses.text: 你們從前在其中生活的時候，也曾經這樣行過。

words.note: Connects verb phrase to noun.
Indicates something happened previously.

verses.text: 但現在你們要除去忿怒、惱怒、惡毒、毀謗，以及粗言穢語這一切事。

words.note: An idiom referring to vulgar or offensive speech.

verses.text: 不要彼此說謊，因為你們已經脫去了舊人和舊人的行為，

words.note: A verb-object compound verb.
Refers to the former, sinful nature or way of life.

verses.text: 穿上了新人。這新人照著他的創造者的形象漸漸更新，能夠充分認識主。

words.note: Refers to the new, regenerated nature in Christ.
Refers to God as the Creator.
Reduplication for emphasis on gradualness.
Refers to God or Jesus Christ.

verses.text: 在這一方面，並不分希臘人和猶太人，受割禮的和未受割禮的，未開化的人和西古提人，奴隸和自由人，唯有基督是一切，也在一切之內。
所以，你們既然是 神所揀選的，是聖潔、蒙愛的人，就要存憐憫的心腸、恩慈、謙卑、溫柔和忍耐。

words.note: Indicates a passive or relative clause, 'that which is done by...'
Lit. 'receive love'
Figuratively, 'inner feelings' or 'disposition'.

verses.heading: Exhortation to Unity and Love

verses.text: 如果有人對別人有嫌隙，總要彼此寬容，互相饒恕；主怎樣饒恕了你們，你們也要照樣饒恕人。
在這一切之上，還要有愛心，愛心是聯繫全德的。

words.note: Refers to the sum of all virtues, completeness in character.

verses.text: 又要讓基督的平安在你們心裡作主；你們蒙召歸為一體，也是為了這個緣故。你們要有感謝的心。

words.note: Lit. 'act as master'.

verses.text: 你們要讓基督的道豐豐富富地住在你們心裡，以各樣的智慧，彼此教導，互相勸戒，用詩章、聖詩、靈歌，懷著感恩的心歌頌 神。

words.note: Here refers to Christ's teaching or message.
Reduplication emphasizes the degree of richness or abundance.
Common in biblical context for spiritual guidance.
The preceding ideographic space (　) is often used for reverence before divine names.

verses.text: 凡你們所作的，無論是言語或行為，都要奉主耶穌的名，藉著他感謝父 神。

words.note: Combines with a verb to mean 'what is done' or 'that which is done'.
Turns 'what you do' into a noun phrase.
Implies acting under authority or with reverence.
Refers to God the Father.
The preceding ideographic space (　) is often used for reverence before divine names.

verses.text: 你們作妻子的，要順服丈夫，這在主裡是合宜的。

words.note: Turns 'those who are wives' into a noun phrase.
Often used in religious or formal contexts for obedience/submission.
Often used with 在 (在...裡) to mean 'in' or 'among'.
More formal than suitable.

verses.heading: Exhortation to Households

verses.text: 你們作丈夫的，要愛妻子，不可苦待她們。

words.note: Turns 'those who are husbands' into a noun phrase.
Often found in biblical or formal admonitions.

verses.text: 你們作兒女的，要凡事聽從父母，因為這在主裡是可喜悅的。

words.note: Turns 'those who are children' into a noun phrase.
Often used with 在 (在...裡) to mean 'in' or 'among'.
Means 'able to cause joy/pleasure', hence 'pleasing'.

verses.text: 你們作父親的，不要激怒兒女，免得他們灰心喪志。

words.note: A four-character idiom meaning 'to be disheartened and lose ambition'.

verses.text: 你們作僕人的，要凡事聽從世上的主人，作事不要只作給人看，像那些討人歡心的一樣，卻要以真誠的心敬畏主。

words.note: Literally 'to seek people's joy/favor'.

verses.text: 無論你們作甚麼，都要從心裡去作，像是為主作的，不是為人作的，

words.note: Used as a verb complement to indicate direction or continuation.

verses.text: 因為你們知道，你們一定會從主那裡得到基業為賞賜。你們應當服事主基督，

words.note: Refers to a family inheritance or legacy.

verses.text: 但那些不義的人，必按他所行的不義受報應。主並不偏待人。

words.note: Forms a nominal phrase from a verb: 'that which is done'.
Often used to intensify a negative statement.
